hb.math.graph
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--hb.math.graph.Graph
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeliefNetwork, JunctionTree
public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Set

Defines a graph G=G(V,E), where V is a set of vertices and E is a set of edges.

See Also:
Vertex, Edge

public java.util.Collection getFamily(java.lang.String name)

getFamily

public java.util.Collection getFamily(Vertex u)
Gets the family of the specified vertex. The family of a vertex u is defined as the union between the vertex itself and its parents; {u} U pa(u).
Returns:
a collection containing the family.

getNeighbors

public java.util.Collection getNeighbors(Vertex u)
Gets the neighbor of the specified vertex. The neighbor of a vertex u is defined as the union between the vertex itself, its parents and its children; {u} U pa(u) U ch(u).
Returns:
a collection containing the neighbor.

isCyclic

public boolean isCyclic()
Checks if the graph contains any cycles. The algorithm used for the test is a depth-first-search algorithm, which is performed more than once only if the graph is modified between calls.
Returns:
true if the graph contains cycles, otherwise false.

isDirected

public boolean isDirected()
Checks if the graph is directed, i.e. if there is any directed edges.
Returns:
true if the graph is directed, otherwise false.

isDAG

public boolean isDAG()
Checks if the graph is a directed acyclic graph (DAG).
Returns:
true if the graph is a DAG, otherwise false.

isTree

public boolean isTree()
Checks if the graph is a undirected acyclic graph (tree).
Returns:
true if the graph is a tree, otherwise false.

isSinglyConnected

public boolean isSinglyConnected()
Checks if the graph is singly connected. A graph is singly connected if you get a tree when you remove all directions on edges.
Returns:
true if the graph is singly connected, otherwise false.

isReachable

public boolean isReachable(Vertex u,
                           Vertex v)
Checks if vertex v is reachable from vertex u. The algorithm used for the test is a breadth-first-search algorithm, which is performed more than once only if the graph is modified between calls.
Returns:
true if vertex v is reachable from vertex u, otherwise false.

the number of vertices added to the graph.

SCC

public java.util.Collection SCC()

SCCGraph

public Graph SCCGraph()

DFS

public java.util.Collection DFS()
Depth-first search algorithm (DFS) as describes in [CorLeiRiv1990, pp478]. It can also be shown that DFS discovers every vertex in V that is reachable from the source s.

BFS

public void BFS(Vertex s)
Breadth-first search algorithm (BFS) as describes in [CorLeiRiv1990, pp469]. It can be shown that BFS allways computes the shortest-path distances. It can also be shown that DFS discovers every vertex in V that is reachable from the source s.

                                   Vertex v)
